value.name: DescribeIntunePolicy
value.description: Summarize and assess the impact of a Microsoft Intune policy.
value.descriptionForModel: Summarize and provide an impact assessment of a Microsoft Intune policy. Extract policy settings, user/device assignments details and assess risks and conflicts for a comprehensive overview
examplePrompts: Tell me what the Intune policy does
What does the Intune policy do
Describe what the Intune policy does
Describe the Intune policy
Any conflicts withing this Intune policy?
Highlight setting conflicts with this policy
Tell me if there are issues with the Intune policy
Are there any known issues or risks with the Intune policy
Summarize the impact of the Intune policy
Provide a comprehensive summary of implementing this Intune policy
Provide an analysis of Intune policy
Validate the Intune policy

inputs.name: Policy
inputs.description: An Intune configuration policy either in a json format with respective settings, policy Name or policy ID. If an policy ID is selected as the input, use the raw ID as the input.

inputs.name: Question
inputs.description: Question or request regarding policy details. A required parameter that provides additional information and context to curate response.

inputs.name: ConflictAnalysisRequired
inputs.description: Required input parameter. Information of potential conflicts areas of policy is relevant to respond to the prompt. true or false.

inputs.name: RiskAssessRequired
inputs.description: Required input parameter. Additional information from assessing risk of policy implementation is relevant to respond to the prompt. true or false.

inputs.name: AssignmentJson
inputs.description: JSON input containing assignment details. Only needed if prompt contains a valid policy assignment json.

value.name: ErrorCodeAnalyzer
value.description: Get detailed information about a device configuration error code.
value.descriptionForModel: Return a description of the error code and insights related to it.
examplePrompts: How do I resolve this error code?
What does this error code mean?
How can I troubleshoot this error code?
Analyze this error code and provide troubleshooting steps?
What does error code mean and how do I troubleshoot it?
Tell me more about error code
What does the error code for Windows failing to install app mean
What does the error code mean when installing app
What does Windows app install error mean

inputs.name: errorCode
inputs.description: The hexidecimal or integer error code

inputs.name: UserRequest
inputs.description: Full user request. Provide error code and platform in which error has occured (i.e. Windows, iOS, Android for app installation)

value.name: GetAppAndPolicyGroupTargeting

value.description: Get a summary of the number of users and devices that an app or policy is assigned to.
value.descriptionForModel: Get the assignment scope (# users / devices) containing included/excluded groups of an Intune Policy/App from its ID or JSON input and provide a summary

Tell me assignment details of my Intune policy?
Summarize the user assignment of Intune configuration policy
How many users are impacted by policy
How many devices are impacted by policy?
Summarize the device assignment of Intune configuration policy?
How many users is assigned to?
How many devices is assigned to
Summarize the user assignment of app
How many users are impacted by app
Who is assigned to the Intune policy
Summarize the assignment of Intune policy:

inputs.name: UserRequest
inputs.description: Full user request

inputs.name: PolicyOrApp
inputs.description: The configuration policy either in a json format with respective settings or policy ID or app ID or policy name or app name

value.name: GetAppOrPolicyDeviceGroupTargeting
value.displayName: Understand why a device has app or policy
value.description: Get info about why a managed device has a policy or app by checking its group memberships.
value.descriptionForModel: Gets information about why a device is targeted with a policy or an app, it checks if the device is part of a group that the policy or an app is assigned to
examplePrompts: Why is the policy assigned to device
Why is the policy targeted to device
What is the reason for assigning the policy to device
Why is the app assigned to the device
What is the reason for assigning the app to the device

inputs.name: UserRequest
inputs.description: Full user request

inputs.name: PolicyOrApp
inputs.description: The policy or app ID or name. This can be a guid or name

inputs.name: Device
inputs.description: The device ID or name

skillSummaryMetadata.summaryStartMessage: Getting app or policy targeting information ...
skillSummaryMetadata.summaryEndMessage: Got app or policy targeting information

value.name: GetIntuneDeviceDiff
value.displayName: Get device configuration differences between two devices
value.description: Get a summary of similarities and differences in the configuration of two managed devices.
value.descriptionForModel: Gets the differences or a comparison between two intune devices for a specified category of data
examplePrompts: Show me the differences between and hardware configurations.
How different and hardware configurations are?
How is hardware configuration different from ?
Compare and hardware configurations
Show me the differences between and device configurations.
How different and device configurations are?
How is device configuration different from?
Compare and device configurations
Show me the differences between and device compliance policies.
How different and device compliance policies are?
How is device compliance policy different from?
Compare and device compliance policies
What are the differences between and app compliance policies?
Show me the differences between and app configuration policies.
How different and app configuration policies are?
How is app configuration policy different from?
Compare and app configuration policies
Show me the differences between and discovered apps.
How different and discovered apps are?
How are discovered apps different from?
Compare and discovered apps
Show me the differences between and managed apps.
How different and managed apps are?
How are managed apps different from?
Compare and managed apps
Show me the difference between and app crash events in the past days.
How different and app crash events are in the past days?
How are application crash or hang events different from and in the past days?
Compare and application crash or hang events in the past days

inputs.name: UserRequest
inputs.description: Full user question to compare two devices. Supported options are Hardware, Managed Apps, Discovered Apps, App Configuration Policies, Configuration Profiles, Compliance Policies

inputs.name: Device1
inputs.description: Device1 device name or intune/aad device id

inputs.name: Device2
inputs.description: Device2 device name or intune/aad device id

inputs.name: PolicyType
inputs.description: What the information want to compare for the two devices, it could be HARDWARE, AppConfigurationPolicy for 'App Configuration Policy', ConfigurationPolicy for 'Configuration Policy', CompliancePolicy for 'Compliance Policy', DiscoveredApps for 'Discovered Apps', ManagedApps for 'Managed Apps', AppCrash for 'App crash data'.

inputs.name: LookbackDurationInHours
inputs.description: Number of hours to lookback when getting device timeline events

value.name: GetIntuneDeviceDiscoveredOrManagedApplication
value.displayName: Get discovered or managed apps for device
value.description: Get a list of Intune managed apps, or softwares, appliations installed on a managed device, or get info about an app.
value.descriptionForModel: Returns a list of discovered or managed application installed on a Microsoft Intune managed device or specific information about an app.
examplePrompts: List discovered apps on device
Give me the list and count of applications that are discovered on this Intune device
What applications are discovered by Intune on device
Is this app on my device?
Is there any discovered application on this device that contains this string
List managed apps on device
What applications are managed by Intune on device
Is this managed app on my device?
Is installed on?
Is this app managed or unmanaged for this Intune device?
Which managed application on device have install failures?
Does Application Foo have install failures on my device?

inputs.name: UserRequest
inputs.description: Full user request. Supported options are managed apps and discovered apps

inputs.name: Device
inputs.description: Device name or intune/aad device id

inputs.name: PolicyType
inputs.description: The application type, it could be ManagedApps for 'Managed Apps', or DiscoveredApps for 'Discovered Apps', set it as DiscoveredApps for softwares or applications installed on the device

inputs.name: AppName
inputs.description: The application name

inputs.name: InstallationState
inputs.description: Installation status, it could be NotApplicable, Installed, Failed, NotInstalled, UninstallFailed, PendingInstall, AvailableToInstall or Unknown. Do not set this parameter if the user has not specified

value.name: GetIntuneDeviceGroupMemberships
value.description: Summarize the group memberships of a managed device.
value.descriptionForModel: Get the group memberships of an Intune Device and provide a summary
examplePrompts: Summarize the group membership of my device
Show me the group membership for device
What groups is Device a member of?
What group is part of?
What group is Device in?
is part of the what groups?

inputs.name: Device
inputs.description: The device ID/Name

inputs.name: GroupName
inputs.description: The group name the device is a member of

value.name: GetIntuneDevices
value.description: Get summary of managed devices with key information for a user.
value.descriptionForModel: Returns a list of devices managed by Microsoft Intune. Use this function to retrieve information about devices managed by Intune.
examplePrompts: Tell me about device
Get the device info from Intune
Summarize device from Intune
Summarize device
Get all machines associated with
Get the devices for
Get the machines for
Which Intune devices associated
Which Intune machines associated
What devices associated with
What machines associated with
Show me my devices.
What are my machines
Show me Intune devices for
show me all the windows devices for
Show me the devices enrolled by in recent 5 days
Show me related device data for this device
Show me related device data for this user
Who is the prirmary user of the device

inputs.name: User
inputs.description: Azure AD user ID or UPN for a user, set as me for current user, if multiple users found, delimited with comma

inputs.name: Device
inputs.description: Device ID or name, if multiple devices found, delimited with comma

inputs.name: Platform
inputs.description: Operating system, it could be Windows, iOS, Android, Linux or macOS, if multiple OS found, delimited with comma

inputs.name: StartEnrollmentDate
inputs.description: Device enrolled start date

inputs.name: EndEnrollmentDate
inputs.description: Device enrolled end date

inputs.name: StartLastCheckinDate
inputs.description: Device last check-in start date

inputs.name: EndLastCheckinDate
inputs.description: Device last check-in end date

inputs.name: ComplianceState
inputs.description: Device compliance state, it could be one of these states 'Compliant' or 'Noncompliant' or 'Not evaluated', don't set it if no match

inputs.name: CompliancePolicy
inputs.description: Compliance policy name or id if user want to know the non compliance device number for a sepecific complaince policy, don't set it if no match

value.name: GetPoliciesPerDevice
value.displayName: Get policies assigned to a device
value.description: Get info on policies assigned to a managed device, including device config, app config, and compliance.
value.descriptionForModel: Gets the device config/app config/device compliance policies  for a Microsoft Intune managed device
examplePrompts: Device compliance policy for Device [Device]
Show me the device compliance Policy for device [Device]
What device compliance policies are assigned to device [Device]
What policies are targeted on device [Device]
List all policies on device [Device]
Tell me about the policies on device [Device]
List device configuration policies on device [Device]
Is this device configuration policy on device [Device]
Tell me about device configuration policies on device [Device]
What app configuration policies are targeted on device [Device]
List app configuration policies on device [Device]
Tell me about app configuration policies on device [Device]

inputs.name: Input
inputs.description: The full user request or filters. Policy types supported by this skill are App Configuration Policies, Device Compliance and Configuration Policies

inputs.name: Device
inputs.description: The device ID or name

inputs.name: PolicyType
inputs.description: The Intune policy type user want to check, it could be ConfigurationPolicy for 'Configuration policy', or CompliancePolicy for 'Compliance policy', or AppConfigurationPolicy for 'App configuration policy'

skillSummaryMetadata.summaryStartMessage: Getting policy configuration information for device ...
skillSummaryMetadata.summaryEndMessage: Got policy configuration information for device

value.name: GetPolicySetting
value.description: Get detailed info about a device configuration policy setting, including best practices.
value.descriptionForModel: Provide information about the Intune policy setting (including the setting's category, description, guidance, best practice, sample, risk, dependencies, effectuation and etc.) by the given name of the Intune policy setting. It may return information for multiple policy settings which share the same policy setting name from different policy category.
examplePrompts: Tell me about Intune setting \"Enable Web Sign In\", The setting name is \"Enable Web Sign In\", the platform is \"windows10\", the policy type is \"Settings catalog\", the setting Category is \"Authentication\", the setting ID is \"device_vendor_msft_policy_config_authentication_enablewebsignin\
Tell me about this setting 'Wi-Fi name (SSID)' of Wi-Fi type on Windows 10 and later platform
What information do you have about this Intune setting?
If the Wi-fi setting 'Connect automatically' is set to 'enable', how will it affect user?
If the Device restriction setting 'SmartScreen for Microsoft Edge Legacy' is set to 'Require', how will it affect security?
what does this setting 'Require custom compliance' in Custom Compliance of settings catalog on linux do?
Can this setting 'Antispyware' be configured in another way?
Are there any settings that should be configured along this this setting 'Require device compliance from Configuration Manager'?
Are there any pre-requisites for enabling the 'Firewall' setting in windows10?
How should I configure this setting most securely?
How should I configure this setting for best usability?
Does Microsoft recommend any particular value for this Endpoint protection setting 'Firewall'?

Is there a recommended value for this setting 'Onboard Configuration Package' belongs to 'Microsoft Defender for Endpoint (desktop devices running Windows 10 or later)' on Windows 10 and later by Microsoft?
What value does Microsoft advise for this setting on macOS?
Is there a value for this setting 'Startup authentication required' that Microsoft endorses?
What is the value for this setting 'Startup authentication required' belongs to BitLocker system drive policy that Microsoft proposes?
Does Microsoft suggest a specific value for this setting?
What are the top 5 pre-requisites for enabling the 'Override Shell Program' setting on IOS/iPadOS?
How could this DeviceRestrictions setting 'Firewall' affect users?
How could this win8 setting 'Firewall' affect security?

inputs.name: SettingName
inputs.description: The display name of policy setting

inputs.name: PlatformName
inputs.description: The name of the platform that the setting could be configured on

inputs.name: PolicyType
inputs.description: The type of the policy that the setting could be configured in

inputs.name: SettingCategory
inputs.description: The category that the setting belongs to

inputs.name: SettingId
inputs.description: The id of policy setting

skillSummaryMetadata.summaryStartMessage: Getting information about configuration policy setting ...
skillSummaryMetadata.summaryEndMessage: Got information for configuration policy setting info

value.name: GetPolicySettingUsage
value.displayName: Learn where my policies use a specified setting
value.description: Get info about whether any existing device configuration policies contain a specified setting.
value.descriptionForModel: Provide usage info about the Intune policy setting (including the associated policy name, associated policy description, setting name, setting description, setting type, setting value, recommended value and etc.) by the given name of the Intune policy setting. It may return usage info for multiple policy settings which share the same policy setting name from different policy.
examplePrompts: Where is this win10 vpn setting 'Always On' enabled?
Where is this iOS setting 'Voice Control' of App Lock disabled?
Give me the policies which 'Always On' == 'enabled'
Tell me the policies which 'Always On' is 'enabled'
Has this setting 'Always On' been configured as 'enabled'?
Am I introducing a new setting or new value for existing setting 'Antivirus' into my environment?
Show me where I've configured this setting in other Intune policies
What configurations do I already have for this configuration setting 'Health monitoring
Have I configured this setting 'Disable Touch' in settings catalog already?
Has this setting 'Antivirus' been configured in any other security baseline policies?
What value do other customers configure for this win10 setting 'Health monitoring'?
